title: Why This Newsletter? And Why Now?
opening_paragraphs: Why This Newsletter? And Why Now?
Every morning when I wake up, I find my inbox full of updates on new AI models, techniques, and tools. The headlines are loud; another breakthrough is just around the corner.

And yet, in my many conversations every day with senior business executives, product leaders, and operations teams, I hear something else entirely. It‚Äôs not panic or urgency as most would expect, but a quiet, persistent question: How do we actually make use of this in a way that‚Äôs meaningful, ethical, secure, and legally compliant?

title: A Business Leader's Playbook for AI Process Innovation
opening_paragraphs: A Business Leader's Playbook for AI Process Innovation

AI applications span a wide spectrum: from basic decision tree systems to self-learning models and sophisticated multi-agent architectures capable of autonomous reasoning and task execution. And the technology continues to evolve practically every day.
But what can AI actually do to solve real business problems? The answer is more nuanced than you might expect: it can‚Äôt do much; at least not without human involvement.

title: The AI Cold Start Problem: Strategies for Business Leaders
opening_paragraphs: The Cold Start Problem

Years ago, I was working for a company that launched a marketplace for corporate training courses. Each new customer required a tailored conversation with a company representative who would compile a personalized curriculum based on their needs. They were eager to implement a smart AI recommendation engine to reduce their workload so they could scale more efficiently. However, there was one glaring problem: they didn‚Äôt have a lot of customer data. Few records of purchase histories, company profiles, and marketplace browsing behavior. The AI engine was limited in its recommendations because there simply wasn‚Äôt enough data.

This experience culminated in one of the most important lessons I‚Äôve learned in AI: the quantity and quality of your data is the ultimate limiting factor. No matter how good your AI models are, without plentiful and good data, they can‚Äôt do their job. Data is more than just fuel for AI; it‚Äôs the very foundation everything else is built on.
closing_paragraphs: Don't let data scarcity slow down your digital transformation!
Read the full article for actionable steps. #DigitalTransformation #BusinessStrategy #RaiseYourAIQ #Innovation #ProductManagement

title: The Future of AI-Driven Software Modernization
opening_paragraphs: The Future of Software Modernization: A Strategic Imperative for Business Leaders

For the past several years, my team and I have worked on a project modernizing a legacy disease management system for the State of Michigan‚Äôs public health department. Before our project began, the director of the State‚Äôs Health and Human Services (HHS) regularly struggled with the reality of a 20-year-old legacy system: poor user experience and system performance, aging infrastructure, and costly support and maintenance. This all came to a head in March 2020 with the onset of the global COVID-19 pandemic.

Shortly after the pandemic was declared, the HHS Director expanded his team in an effort to quickly get ahead of the outbreak. The legacy system couldn‚Äôt cope with increased user and data loads, and the surging number of volunteer users couldn‚Äôt figure out how to properly use it. Faced with rising demands and growing inefficiencies, he took the plunge and chose to modernize the system rather than continue paying for costly, patchwork upgrades, finally setting a course to retire what had become a classic Rube Goldberg machine.

title: Convenience Over Perfection: The Competitive Advantage in GenAI Adoption
opening_paragraphs: Convenience Over Perfection: The Competitive Advantage in GenAI Adoption

When I turned 50 back in 2023, I decided it was time to join the gym again. But this time I was determined not to repeat my old cycle: join a gym, get injured, quit soon after, then spend months struggling to cancel the membership.

This time, I picked a coworking space with a gym and a trainer to remove excuses. The trainer gave me a diet plan and a daily 1,800-calorie target‚Äîplus homework: log everything I ate for a week. Tracking meals turned out to be a hassle, even when using top apps like MyFitnessPal. In fact, I found the app clunkier than a pen and paper food journal. At the time, ChatGPT just launched custom GPTs with computer vision features, so I started experimenting.
closing_paragraphs: What are your thoughts on "convenience over perfection" in AI adoption? Share below! üëá
potential_section_headers: The tradeoff that actually matters: convenience vs. perfection
There‚Äôs a spectrum in building solutions with GenAI:
Do you see sustained weekly active users?
Are failures clustering into patterns you can address?
Is there a regulated or mission-critical need surfacing?

title: 90% People, 10% Technology: Why AI Fails Without Change Management
opening_paragraphs: 90% People, 10% Technology: Why AI Fails Without Change Management

Contrary to popular perception, most AI failures don‚Äôt really look like crashes at all. They look like silence; the AI launches, the dashboards load, and the frontline keeps doing what they‚Äôve always done.

Case in point, a manufacturing client of ours wanted a ‚Äúquick fix‚Äù to a sales forecast the last vendor built but no one used. We urged meeting the people who rely on the forecast upfront; the response was ‚Äújust improve the model.‚Äù Tests looked great: better features, cleaner data, lower error, yet adoption didn‚Äôt budge. After go‚Äëlive, the real issue surfaced: the user interface didn‚Äôt fit how revenue leaders prefer to review demand, controls felt foreign, and graphs lagged. The model wasn‚Äôt the blocker; lack of focus on the user experience was.
closing_paragraphs: Share your insights and react below! üëá
sample_bullets: - Organizational Readiness is Key: Value from AI is a function of strategy, technical excellence, and organizational readiness. Without readiness, even elegant AI solutions fall flat.

- AI Needs a Different Playbook: Unlike traditional software, AI is a probabilistic copilot that changes how judgment is exercised. It requires continuous iteration, re-architecting decision flows, and building trust.

- Core Principles Make AI Stick: Executive alignment, early stakeholder engagement, building trust by design, reskilling (not just retraining), strategic communication, and continuous feedback loops are crucial for successful AI adoption.
